channel.title: pycon2005 on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: A Plan for GUI Testing
item.description: During my presentation on Developing Desktop Applications with Python at PyCon last month, one question in particular intrigued me: “How do you handle unit testing for user interfaces.

item.title: PyCon Wrap Up
item.description: PyCon is over, and I head back to balmy Indiana tomorrow.

item.title: PyCon Day 3
item.description: Today was the final day of PyCon.

item.title: PyCon Notes
item.description: I just noticed that Ted Leung is once again hosting PyCon SubEthaEdit notes.

item.title: PyCon Day 2
item.description: Today was presentation day, which understandably occupied most of my thinking.

item.title: PyCon Day 1
item.description: So the first day of PyCon is over.

item.title: (re) Mixing Python
item.description: This morning’s keynote at PyCon was given by Jim Huginin, formerly of Jython fame, now of IronPython fame.

item.title: PyCon 2005
item.description: I’m in Washington, DC for the remainder of the week for PyCon 2005 .

item.description: So I’m trying to get my slides put together for PyCon.

item.title: Preparing for PyCon
item.description: PyCon 2005 is next week at GWU in Washington, DC.

item.title: Mr. CC Goes to Washington… and Oxford
item.description: It’s time for that annual rite of Python: PyCon .
